translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا کافران ندیدند خدایی که آسمانها و زمین را آفرید و هیچ از آفرینش آنها فرو نماند البته هم او قادر بر آن است که مردگان را باز زنده کند؟ آری البته او بر هر چیز قادر است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا نمی‌دانند خدائی که آسمانها و زمین را آفریده است و در آفرینش آنها خسته و درمانده نشده است، می‌تواند مردگان را زنده کند؟! آری، او بر هر کاری توانا است. [[«لَمْ یَعْیَ»: درمانده نشده است. از ماده (عیی).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا نیندیشیده‌اند که خداوندی که آسمانها و زمین را آفریده است، و در آفرینش آنها در نمانده است، توانای آن است که مردگان را زنده بدارد، آری او بر هر کاری تواناست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا آنها نمی‌دانند خداوندی که آسمانها و زمین را آفریده و از آفرینش آنها ناتوان نشده است، می‌تواند مُردگان را زنده کند؟! آری او بر هر چیز تواناست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا ندیدند آنکه خداوندی که آفرید آسمانها و زمین را و خسته نگردید از آفریدن آنها توانا است که زنده کند مُردگان را بلی همانا او است بر همه چیز توانا

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا نديده‌ايد- ندانسته‌اند- كه آن خداى كه آسمانها و زمين را آفريد و در آفريدن آنها ناتوان و وامانده نشد تواناست بر اينكه مردگان را زنده كند؟ آرى، او بر هر چيزى تواناست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا و ندانستند آن خدایی که آسمان‌ها و زمین را آفرید -حال آنکه در آفریدن آنها درمانده نگردید- می‌تواند مردگان را (نیز) زنده کند؟ آری، همواره اوست که بر همه چیزی بسیار تواناست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do they not realise that God who created the heavens and the earth, and did not tire creating them, is able to bring the dead to life? And why not? He has the power over everything.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Have they not realised that Allah, Who did not tire in creating the heavens and the earth and in creating them, is Able to revive the dead? Surely yes, why not? Indeed He is Able to do all things.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, have they not seen that God who created the heavens and earth, not being wearied by creating them, is able to give life to the dead? Yes indeed; He is powerful over everything.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Bethink they not that Allah Who created the heavens and the earth and was not fatigued with the creation thereof, is able to quicken the dead? Aye! verily He is over everything Potent.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Do they not see that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, and was not wearied by their creation, is Able to give life to the dead? Yes, He surely is Able to do all things.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Do they not realize that God, who created the heavens and the earth, and was never tired by creating them, is Able to revive the dead? Yes indeed; He is Capable of everything.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do they not see that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth -- and creating them did not wear Him out -- has the power to bring the dead back to life? Why not! He certainly has the power over everything.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Do they not see that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, and was not wearied by their creation, is Able to give life to the dead Yes, He surely is Able to do all things.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Have they not seen that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth and was not wearied by their creation, is Able to give life to the dead? Aye, He verily is Able to do all things.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and the earth and [who] was not exhausted by their creation, is able to revive the dead? Yes, indeed He has power over all things.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Have they not seen that it is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and was not wearied by their creation, and that He is Able to restore the dead tolife? Yes, He has power over all things!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and earth and did not fail in their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Yes. Indeed, He is over all things competent.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Have they not seen that God has created the heavens and the earth and that He experienced no fatigue in doing this. He has the power to bring the dead back to life. Certainly He has power over all things.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Have they not considered that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth and was not tired by their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Aye! He has surely power over all things.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Awalam yaraw anna Allaha allathee khalaqa alssamawati waalarda walam yaAAya bikhalqihinna biqadirin AAala an yuhyiya almawta bala innahu AAala kulli shayin qadeerun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have they not seen that God, who created the heavens and the earth and was not wearied by their creation, has the power to bring the dead back to life? Yes, indeed, He has power over all things.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: See they not that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, and never wearied with their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Yea, verily He has power over all things.

verses.text: وَ يَوْمَ‌ يُعْرَضُ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا عَلَى‌ النَّارِ أَ لَيْسَ‌ هٰذَا بِالْحَقِ‌ قَالُوا بَلَى‌ وَ رَبِّنَا قَالَ‌ فَذُوقُوا الْعَذَابَ‌ بِمَا کُنْتُمْ‌ تَکْفُرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و روزی که کافران را بر آتش عرضه می کنند [از آنان می پرسند:] آیا این حق نیست؟ می گویند: آری! سوگند به پروردگارمان حق است، [پرسش کننده] می گوید: پس این عذاب را برای آنکه همواره کفر می ورزیدید، بچشید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: روزى كه كافران به آتش عرضه شوند: آيا اين حقيقت نيست؟ گويند: بلى، به پروردگارمان سوگند. گويد: به خاطر كفرى كه مى‌ورزيده‌ايد، اينك عذاب را بچشيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و روزى كه كافران بر آتش عرضه شوند [منادى گويد:] آيا اين [آتش‌] حق نيست؟ گويند: چرا، به پروردگارمان سوگند [كه حق است‌]. گويد: پس به سزاى اين كه انكار مى‌كرديد عذاب را بچشيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و روزى كه كافران بر آتش عرضه مى‌شوند [از آنان مى‌پرسند:] «آيا اين راست نيست؟» مى‌گويند: «سوگند به پروردگارمان كه آرى.» مى‌فرمايد: «پس به [سزاى‌] آنكه انكار مى‌كرديد عذاب را بچشيد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و روزی که کافران را بر آتش دوزخ عرضه کنند (به آنها گویند) آیا این وعده دوزخ حقیقت نبود؟ گویند: بلی به پروردگارمان سوگند که حق بود. خدا گوید: پس امروز به کیفر کفرتان سختی عذاب دوزخ را بچشید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: روزی کافران را به کنار دوزخ می‌برند و ایشان را بر آن عرضه می‌کنند (و بدیشان گفته می‌شود:) آیا این حقیقت ندارد؟! می‌گویند: بلی، سوگند به پروردگارمان. خدا بدیشان می‌گوید: پس به سبب کفر و ناباوریتان عذاب را بچشید. [[«یُعْرَضُ»: (نگا: غافر / 46، احقاف / 20).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و روزی که کافران را به نزدیک آتش [دوزخ‌] بدارند [و از ایشان بپرسند] آیا این [وعده‌] حق نیست؟ گویند چرا سوگند به پروردگارمان گوید پس عذاب را به خاطر آنکه [انکار و] کفرمی‌ورزیدید بچشید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: روزی را به یاد آور که کافران را بر آتش عرضه می‌دارند (و به آنها گفته می‌شود:) آیا این حقّ نیست؟! می‌گویند: «آری، به پروردگارمان سوگند (که حقّ است)!» (در این هنگام خداوند) می‌گوید: «پس عذاب را بخاطر کفرتان بچشید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و روزی که عرضه شوند کافران بر آتش آیا نیست این حقّ گفتند بلی سوگند به پروردگار ما گفت پس بچشید عذاب را بدانچه بودید کفر می‌ورزیدید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و روزى كه كافران را بر آتش دوزخ عرضه كنند [به آنها گويند:] آيا اين حق نيست- كه شما آن را انكار مى‌كرديد-؟ گويند: آرى، به پروردگارمان سوگند [كه حق است خداى‌] گويد: پس بچشيد عذاب را به سزاى آنكه كفر مى‌ورزيديد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و روزی که کافران بر آتش نمایش داده می‌شوند (از آنان پرسیده شود:) «آیا این حق نیست‌؟» گویند: «سوگند به پروردگارمان (که) آری!‌» فرمود: «پس به (سزای) آنچه کفر می‌ورزیده‌اید عذاب را بچشید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The day the unbelievers will be stood before the Fire, (they will be asked:) "Is this not the reality?" They will answer: "In truth, by our Lord!" It will be said: "Then taste the torment of what you had denied."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And on the day when the disbelievers are presented upon the fire; it will be said, “Is this not a reality?” They will answer, “By oath of our Lord, surely yes, why not?”; it will be said, “Therefore taste the punishment, the recompense of your disbelief.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Upon the day when the unbelievers are exposed to the Fire: 'Is not this the truth?' They shall say, 'Yes, by our Lord!' He shall say, 'Then taste the chastisement of your unbelief!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And on the Day whereon those who disbelieve will be placed before the Fire: is this not real? They will say: yea, by our Lord. He will say: taste wherefore the torment, for ye have been disbelieving.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And on the Day when those who disbelieve will be exposed to the Fire (it will be said to them): "Is this not the truth?" They will say: "Yes, By our Lord!" He will say: "Then taste the torment, because you used to disbelieve!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On the Day when those who disbelieved are presented to the Fire: “Is this not real?” They will say, “Yes, indeed, by our Lord.” He will say, “Then taste the suffering for having disbelieved.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: On the Day when the unbelievers will be brought within sight of the Fire, they will be asked: “Is this not the Truth?” and they will answer “Yes, by Our Lord (this is the Truth).” Allah will say: “Then suffer the chastisement as a requital for your disbelieving.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And on the Day when those who disbelieve will be exposed to the Fire (it will be said to them): "Is this not the truth" They will say: "Yes, by our Lord!" He will say: "Then taste the torment, because you used to disbelieve!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And on the day when those who disbelieve are exposed to the Fire (they will be asked): Is not this real? They will say: Yea, by our Lord. He will say: Then taste the doom for that ye disbelieved.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The day when the faithless are exposed to the Fire, [He will say,] ‘Is this not a fact?’ They will say, ‘Yes, by our Lord!’ He will say, ‘So taste the punishment because of what you used to disbelieve.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On the Day when the unbelievers are brought before the Fire they shall be asked: 'Is this not the truth' 'Yes, by our Lord' they will answer. He will say:'Then taste the punishment, for you were unbelievers'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the Day those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "Is this not the truth?" They will say, "Yes, by our Lord." He will say, "Then taste the punishment because you used to disbelieve."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On the day when the disbelievers will be exposed to the fire, they will be asked, "Is this not real?" They will say, "Yes, Our Lord, it is real" He will say, "Suffer the torment for your disbelief".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And on the day when those who disbelieve shall be brought before the fire: Is it not true? They shall say: Aye! by our Lord! He will say: Then taste the punishment, because you disbelieved.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wayawma yuAAradu allatheena kafaroo AAala alnnari alaysa hatha bialhaqqi qaloo bala warabbina qala fathooqoo alAAathaba bima kuntum takfuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On the Day when those who deny the truth will be brought before the Fire, they shall be asked, "Is this not the truth?" They will reply, "Yes, by our Lord." He will say, "Then taste the punishment, because of your denial of the truth."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And on the Day that the Unbelievers will be placed before the Fire, (they will be asked,) "Is this not the Truth?" they will say, "Yea, by our Lord!" (One will say:) "Then taste ye the Penalty, for that ye were wont to deny (Truth)!"

verses.text: فَاصْبِرْ کَمَا صَبَرَ أُولُوا الْعَزْمِ‌ مِنَ‌ الرُّسُلِ‌ وَ لاَ تَسْتَعْجِلْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ کَأَنَّهُمْ‌ يَوْمَ‌ يَرَوْنَ‌ مَا يُوعَدُونَ‌ لَمْ‌ يَلْبَثُوا إِلاَّ سَاعَةً مِنْ‌ نَهَارٍ بَلاَغٌ‌ فَهَلْ‌ يُهْلَکُ‌ إِلاَّ الْقَوْمُ‌ الْفَاسِقُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس صبر کن همان گونه که پیامبران اولوالعزم صبر کردند، و برای آنان در [نزول عذاب] شتاب مکن، روزی که آنان آنچه را که وعده داده می شوند ببینند، گویی فقط ساعتی از یک روز [در دنیا] درنگ داشتند؛ [این قرآن] ابلاغی است برای همه؛ پس آیا جز مردم نافرمان هلاک می شوند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس پايدارى كن، همچنان كه پيامبران اُولوالعزم پايدارى كرده بودند. و در عقوبتشان شتاب مكن. آن روز كه آن وعده‌اى را كه به آنها داده شده بنگرند، پندارند كه جز به قدر ساعتى از روز در گور درنگ نكرده‌اند. اين تبليغ رسالت است. آيا جز نافرمانان به هلاكت مى‌رسند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس صبر كن همان‌گونه كه پيامبران اولو العزم صبر كردند، و شتاب [در عقوبت‌] آنان مكن. روزى كه آنچه را وعده داده مى‌شوند ببينند، [احساس مى‌كنند كه‌] گويى جز ساعتى از يك روز [در دنيا] نبوده‌اند. [اين‌] ابلاغى است. پس آيا جز مردم نافرمان هلاك مى‌شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس همان گونه كه پيامبران نستوه، صبر كردند، صبر كن، و براى آنان شتابزدگى به خرج مده. روزى كه آنچه را وعده داده مى‌شوند بنگرند، گويى كه آنان جز ساعتى از روز را [در دنيا] نمانده‌اند؛ [اين‌] ابلاغى است. پس آيا جز مردم نافرمان هلاكت خواهند يافت؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای رسول ما) تو هم مانند پیغمبران اولوا العزم (در تبلیغ دین خدا و تحمل اذیّت امت) صبور باش و بر امت به عذاب تعجیل مکن تا روزی که آنچه وعده داده شده به چشم ببینند آن روز پندارند که (در دنیا) به جز ساعتی از روز درنگ نداشتند. (این قرآن و آیات وعده و وعیدش) تبلیغ رسالت و اتمام حجتی است، پس آیا (به قیامت) جز مردم (شهوت پرست) فاسق هیچ کس هلاک خواهد شد؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس (در برابر اذیّت و آزار کافران) شکیبائی کن، آن گونه که پیغمبران أُولُواالعزم (در سختیها) شکیبائی کرده‌اند، و برای (عذاب) آنان شتاب مکن. روزی که ایشان چیزی را مشاهده می‌کنند که بدیشان وعده داده می‌شد، انگار که آنان مدّتی از یک روز در دنیا مانده‌اند (و زندگی کرده‌اند. این قرآن) ابلاغ است و بسنده است. مگر جز مردمان گناهکار و سرکش از اطاعت خدا، هلاک می‌گردند؟! [[«اِصْبِرْ»: شکیبائی کن. مراد از صبر مطلوب در اینجا علاوه از تحمّل رنجها و دردها، مهلت و فرصت دادن به مردمان و انتظار کشیدن است. یعنی ایشان را نفرین نکردن و درخواست عذاب استیصال ننمودن و با عجله مرگ و نابودیشان را خواستار نشدن. «اَلْعَزْم»: اراده محکم و استوار. تصمیم. ثابت و پایدار. «أُوْلُواْ الْعَزْمِ مِنَ الرُّسُلِ»: پیغمبرانی که دارای اراده استوار و ثبات و پایداری بوده‌اند. حرف (مِنْ) تبعیضیّه است، و اشاره به گروه خاصّی از پیغمبران بزرگ است که صاحب شریعت جدید و آئین تازه بوده‌اند و با گرفتاریها و مشکلات بیشتری روبرو شده‌اند. برخی آنان را پنج نفر می‌دانند که عبارتند از: نوح، ابراهیم، موسی، عیسی، محمّد: بعضی تعداد آنان را بیشتر دانسته‌اند. بعضی هم (مِنْ) را بیانیّه به حساب آورده و همه پیغمبران را أُولُواالعزم بشمار آورده‌اند. «لَمْ یَلْبَثُوا ...»: (نگا: روم / 55، یونس / 45). «بَلاغٌ»: ابلاغ. تبلیغ. بسنده. خبر مبتدای محذوف است: هذَا الْقُرْآنُ بَلاغٌ. این قران تبلیغ آسمانی و بسنده برای زندگی مردمان است. این قرآن آخرین ابلاغ و اخطار است! بپائید به سوی خدا برگردید و بیائید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس همان گونه که پیامبران نستوه، صبر کردند، صبر کن، و برای آنان [عذاب را] به شتاب مخواه زیرا روزی که آنچه وعده‌شان داده شده است، بنگرند، گویی جز ساعتی از یک روز به سر نبرده‌اند، [این‌] پیامی است، پس به نابودی کشانده نخواهند شد جز قوم نافرمانان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس صبر کن آن‌گونه که پیامبران «اُولو العزم» صبر کردند، و برای (عذاب) آنان شتاب مکن! هنگامی که وعده‌هایی را که به آنها داده می‌شود ببینند، احساس می‌کنند که گویی فقط ساعتی از یک روز (در دنیا) توقّف داشتند؛ این ابلاغی است برای همگان؛ آیا جز قوم فاسق هلاک می‌شوند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس شکیبا شو چنانکه شکیبا شدند دارندگان عزم از پیمبران و شتاب نخواه برای ایشان گوئیا ایشان روزی که بنگرند آنچه را وعده داده شوند نمانده‌اند جز ساعتی از روز ابلاغی (رساندنی) است پس آیا نابود شوند جز گروه نافرمانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس شكيبايى كن، همچنان كه پيامبران أولو العزم- خداوندان آهنگ استوار و جد و پايدارى، يا صاحبان شريعت و كتاب- شكيبايى كردند و براى آنها [عذاب را] به شتاب مخواه. آن روز كه آنچه را وعده داده مى‌شوند ببينند چنان است كه گويى جز ساعتى از يك روز- در دنيا- درنگ نكرده‌اند. [اين قرآن‌] رسانيدن پيام [خدا] است، پس آيا جز مردم بدكار نافرمان هلاك مى‌شوند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چنان که پیامبران اولوالعزم صبر کردند، صبر کن و برای (عذاب) آنان [:کافران] شتابزده مباش. روزی که آنچه را وعده داده می‌شوند بنگرند، گویی آنان جز ساعتی از روز را (در گذشته) نمانده‌اند؛ (این خود) رسانه‌ای (بزرگ) است. پس آیا جز گروه نافرمانان هلاک می‌شوند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So bear with patience, as the apostles who were constant, bore; and do not be hasty (in demanding punishment) for them. On the day they see what they had been foretold, (they will realise) that they did not stay in the world but only an hour of the day. This is the message to be conveyed: Shall any perish but the ungodly?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore patiently endure (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) like the courageous Noble Messengers had endured, and do not be impatient for them; on the day when they see what they are promised, it will be as if they had not stayed on earth except part of a day; this is to be conveyed; will anyone be destroyed, except the disobedient?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So be thou patient, as the Messengers possessed of constancy were also patient. Seek not to hasten it for them -- it shall be as if on the day they see that they are promised, they had not tarried but for an hour of a single day. A Message to be delivered! And shall any be destroyed but the people of the ungodly?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Bear thou then with patience even as the apostles, endued with resolution bear with patience, and seek not to hasten on for them. On the Day whereon they will behold that wherewith they are threatened, it will seem to them as though they had tarried but an hour of the day. A proclamation this: so none will be destroyed save the nation of transgressors.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Therefore be patient (O Muhammad SAW) as did the Messengers of strong will and be in no haste about them (disbelievers). On the Day when they will see that (torment) with which they are promised (i.e. threatened, it will be) as if they had not stayed more than an hour in a single day. (O mankind! This Quran is sufficient as) a clear Message (or proclamation to save yourself from destruction). But shall any be destroyed except the people who are Al-Fasiqun (the rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So be patient, as the messengers with resolve were patient, and do not be hasty regarding them. On the Day when they witness what they are promised, it will seem as if they had lasted only for an hour of a day. A proclamation: Will any be destroyed except the sinful people?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So bear with patience, (O Prophet), even as the Messengers endowed with firmness of resolve (before you) bore with patience, and do not be hasty in their regard. The Day when they see what they had been warned against they will feel as though they had remained in the world no more than an hour of a day. (The Truth has been conveyed.) Will any, then, suffer perdition except those who disobey?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Therefore be patient as did those of determination among the Messengers and be in no hurry for them. On the Day when they will see what they are promised, it will be as though they had not remained (in the world) except an hour in a day. (This is) a clear Message. But will any be destroyed except the defiantly rebellious people

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then have patience (O Muhammad) even as the stout of heart among the messengers (of old) had patience, and seek not to hasten on (the doom) for them. On the day when they see that which they are promised (it will seem to them) as though they had tarried but an hour of daylight. A clear message. Shall any be destroyed save evil-living folk?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So be patient just as the resolute among the apostles were patient, and do not seek to hasten [the punishment] for them. The day when they see what they are promised, [it will be] as though they had remained [in the world] only an hour of a day. This is a proclamation. So shall anyone be destroyed except the transgressing lot?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Be patient, as the Messengers of might were patient, and do not hasten it for them. On the Day when they see what they have been promised, it will be as if they did not stay except an hour of a day. (This Koran is) a Conveyance! Shall any be destroyed except the nation of evildoers?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So be patient, [O Muhammad], as were those of determination among the messengers and do not be impatient for them. It will be - on the Day they see that which they are promised - as though they had not remained [in the world] except an hour of a day. [This is] notification. And will [any] be destroyed except the defiantly disobedient people?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), exercise patience as did the steadfast Messengers. Do not try to make them suffer the torment immediately; on the day when they will see the torment with which they were threatened, they will think that they had lived no more than an hour. The message has been delivered. No one else will be destroyed except the evil doing people.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore bear up patiently as did the apostles endowed with constancy bear up with patience and do not seek to hasten for them (their doom). On the day that they shall see what they are promised they shall be as if they had not tarried save an hour of the day. A sufficient exposition! Shall then any be destroyed save the transgressing people?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faisbir kama sabara oloo alAAazmi mina alrrusuli wala tastaAAjil lahum kaannahum yawma yarawna ma yooAAadoona lam yalbathoo illa saAAatan min naharin balaghun fahal yuhlaku illa alqawmu alfasiqoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have patience, then, as had the steadfast Messengers before you; and be in no haste about them. On the Day when they see what they are threatened with, it will appear to them as though they had not tarried longer than an hour of a day. [Your responsibility is] to deliver the message: and none but the disobedient shall be destroyed.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Therefore patiently persevere, as did (all) messengers of inflexible purpose; and be in no haste about the (Unbelievers). On the Day that they see the (Punishment) promised them, (it will be) as if they had not tarried more than an hour in a single day. (Thine but) to proclaim the Message: but shall any be destroyed except those who transgress?
